   20: -module(os_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([space_in_cwd/1, quoting/1, cmd_unicode/1, 
   26:          env/1,
   27:          null_in_command/1, space_in_name/1, bad_command/1,
   28: 	 find_executable/1, unix_comment_in_command/1, deep_list_command/1,
   29:          large_output_command/1, background_command/0, background_command/1,
   30:          message_leak/1, close_stdin/0, close_stdin/1, max_size_command/1,
   31:          cmd_exception/1, os_cmd_shell/1,os_cmd_shell_peer/1,
   32:          perf_counter_api/1, error_info/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() ->
   37:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   38:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [space_in_cwd, quoting, cmd_unicode, null_in_command,
   42:      space_in_name, bad_command,
   43:      env,
   44:      find_executable, unix_comment_in_command, deep_list_command,
   45:      large_output_command, background_command, message_leak,
   46:      close_stdin, max_size_command, perf_counter_api,
   47:      error_info, os_cmd_shell, os_cmd_shell_peer,
   48:      cmd_exception].
   49: 
   50: groups() ->
   51:     [].
   52: 
   53: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   54:     Config.
   55: 
   56: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   57:     ok.
   58: 
   59: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: init_per_testcase(TC, Config)
   66:   when TC =:= background_command; TC =:= close_stdin ->
   67:     case os:type() of
   68:         {win32, _} ->
   69:             {skip,"Should not work on windows"};
   70:         _ ->
   71:             Config
   72:     end;
   73: init_per_testcase(_TC,Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_testcase(_,_Config) ->
   77:     ok.
   78: 
   79: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     Env0 = os:env(),
   81:     GetEnv0 = os:getenv(),
   82:     lists:foldl(fun({K,V}, [KV | T]) ->
   83:                         KV = K ++ "=" ++ V,
   84:                         V = os:getenv(K),
   85:                         V = os:getenv(K, default),
   86:                         T
   87:                 end,
   88:                 GetEnv0,
   89:                 Env0),
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: %% Test that executing a command in a current working directory
   93: %% with space in its name works.
   94: space_in_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   95:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   96:     Dirname = filename:join(PrivDir, "cwd with space"),
   97:     ok = file:make_dir(Dirname),
   98:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dirname),
   99: 
  100:     %% Using `more' gives the almost the same result on both Unix and Windows.
  101: 
  102:     Cmd = case os:type() of
  103: 	      {win32, _} ->
  104: 		  "more";
  105: 	      {unix, _} ->
  106: 		  "more </dev/null"
  107: 	  end,
  108: 
  109:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  110: 	[] -> ok;				% Unix.
  111: 	"\r\n" -> ok;			% Windows.
  112: 	Other ->
  113: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  114:     end,
  115: 
  116:     ct:sleep(5),
  117:     [] = receive_all(),
  118:     ok.
  119: 
  120: %% Test that various ways of quoting arguments work.
  121: quoting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  122:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  123:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  124: 
  125:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  126:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  127:     comp("one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\"")),
  128:     comp("x::one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\" y")),
  129:     comp("x::one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\"")),
  130:     comp("one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\" y")),
  131:     comp("x::::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"\" y")),
  132:     ct:sleep(5),
  133:     [] = receive_all(),
  134:     ok.
  135: 
  136: 
  137: %% Test that unicode arguments work.
  138: cmd_unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  139:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  140:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  141: 
  142:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  143:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  144:     comp("åäö::ϼΩ", os:cmd(Echo ++ " åäö " ++ [1020, 937])),
  145:     ct:sleep(5),
  146:     [] = receive_all(),
  147:     ok.
  148: 
  149: null_in_command(_Config) ->
  150:     {Ok, Error} = case os:type() of
  151:                       {win32,_} -> {"dir", "di\0r"};
  152:                       _ -> {"ls", "l\0s"}
  153:                   end,
  154:     true = is_list(try os:cmd(Ok) catch Class0:_ -> Class0 end),
  155:     error = try os:cmd(Error) catch Class1:_ -> Class1 end,
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: %% Test that program with a space in its name can be executed.
  159: space_in_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  161:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  162:     Spacedir = filename:join(PrivDir, "program files"),
  163:     Ext = case os:type() of
  164: 	      {win32,_} -> ".exe";
  165: 	      _ -> ""
  166: 	  end,
  167:     OrigEcho = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  168:     Echo0 = filename:join(Spacedir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  169: 
  170:     %% Copy the `my_echo' program to a directory whose name contains a space.
  171: 
  172:     ok = file:make_dir(Spacedir),
  173:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(OrigEcho),
  174:     ok = file:write_file(Echo0, Bin),
  175:     Echo = filename:nativename(Echo0),
  176:     ok = file:change_mode(Echo, 8#777),	% Make it executable on Unix.
  177: 
  178:     %% Run the echo program.
  179:     %% Quoting on windows depends on if the full path of the executable
  180:     %% contains special characters. Paths when running common_tests always
  181:     %% include @, why Windows would always fail if we do not double the
  182:     %% quotes (this is the behaviour of cmd.exe, not Erlang's idea).
  183:     Quote = case os:type() of
  184:                 {win32,_} ->
  185: 		    case (Echo -- "&<>()@^|") =:= Echo of
  186: 		        true -> "\"";
  187: 			false -> "\"\""
  188: 	 	    end;
  189: 		_ ->
  190: 		    "\""
  191: 	    end,
  192:     comp("", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote)),
  193:     comp("a::b::c", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote ++ " a b c")),
  194:     ct:sleep(5),
  195:     [] = receive_all(),
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: %% Check that a bad command doesn't crasch the server or the emulator (it used to).
  199: bad_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  200:     catch os:cmd([a|b]),
  201:     catch os:cmd({bad, thing}),
  202: 
  203:     %% This should at least not crash (on Unix it typically returns
  204:     %% a message from the shell).
  205:     os:cmd("xxxxx"),
  206: 
  207:     ok.
  208: 
  209: cmd_exception(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  210: 
  211:     {"abc\n", 2} = cmd_exception_test("echo \"abc\" && exit 2"),
  212:     {_, 2} = cmd_exception_test("("),
  213:     ok.
  214: 
  215: cmd_exception_test(Cmd) ->
  216:     os:cmd(Cmd), %% Check that no exception is generated when the option is not given
  217:     try
  218:         os:cmd(Cmd, #{ exception_on_failure => true}),
  219:         ct:fail("Should not succeed")
  220:     catch error:{command_failed, Out, Reason} ->
  221:             {Out, Reason}
  222:     end.
  223: 
  224: 
  225: find_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  226:     case os:type() of
  227: 	{win32, _} ->
  228: 	    DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "win32"),
  229: 	    ok = file:set_cwd(filename:join([DataDir, "current"])),
  230: 	    Bin = filename:join(DataDir, "bin"),
  231: 	    Abin = filename:join(DataDir, "abin"),
  232: 	    UsrBin = filename:join([DataDir, "usr", "bin"]),
  233: 	    {ok, Current} = file:get_cwd(),
  234: 
  235: 	    Path = lists:concat([Bin, ";", Abin, ";", UsrBin]),
  236: 	    io:format("Path = ~s", [Path]),
  237: 
  238: 	    %% Search for programs in Bin (second element in PATH).
  239: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  240: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  241: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  242: 	    %% OTP-3626 find names of executables given with extension
  243: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.exe", "", Path),
  244: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.com", "", Path),
  245: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb.bat", "", Path),
  246: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.EXE", "", Path),
  247: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.COM", "", Path),
  248: 	    find_exe(Abin, "MY_ADB.BAT", "", Path),
  249: 
  250: 	    %% Search for programs in Abin (second element in PATH).
  251: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  252: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  253: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  254: 
  255: 	    %% Search for programs in the current working directory.
  256: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_program", ".exe", Path),
  257: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_command", ".com", Path),
  258: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_batch", ".bat", Path),
  259: 	    ok;
  260: 	{unix, _}  ->
  261: 	    DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  262: 
  263: 	    %% Smoke test.
  264: 	    case ct:get_progname() of
  265: 		"erl" ->
  266: 		    ErlPath = os:find_executable("erl"),
  267: 		    true = is_list(ErlPath),
  268: 		    true = filelib:is_regular(ErlPath);
  269: 		_ ->
  270: 		    %% Don't bother -- the progname could include options.
  271: 		    ok
  272: 	    end,
  273: 
  274: 	    %% Never return a directory name.
  275: 	    false = os:find_executable("unix", [DataDir]),
  276: 	    ok
  277:     end.
  278: 
  279: find_exe(Where, Name, Ext, Path) ->
  280:     Expected = filename:join(Where, Name++Ext),
  281:     case os:find_executable(Name, Path) of
  282: 	Expected ->
  283: 	    ok;
  284: 	Name when is_list(Name) ->
  285: 	    case filename:absname(Name) of
  286: 		Expected ->
  287: 		    ok;
  288: 		Other ->
  289: 		    io:format("Expected ~p; got (converted to absolute) ~p",
  290: 			      [Expected, Other]),
  291: 		    ct:fail(failed)
  292: 	    end;
  293: 	Other ->
  294: 	    io:format("Expected ~p; got ~p", [Expected, Other]),
  295: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  296:     end.
  297: 
  298: %% OTP-1805: Test that os:cmd(\ls #\) works correctly (used to hang).
  299: unix_comment_in_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  301:     ok = file:set_cwd(Priv),
  302:     _ = os:cmd("ls #"),			% Any result is ok.
  303:     ct:sleep(5),
  304:     [] = receive_all(),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: %% Check that a deep list in command works equally on unix and on windows.
  308: deep_list_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  309:     %% As a 'io_lib' module description says: "There is no guarantee that the
  310:     %% character lists returned from some of the functions are flat, they can
  311:     %% be deep lists."
  312:     %% That's why os:cmd/1 can have arguments that are deep lists.
  313:     %% It is not a problem for unix, but for windows it is (in R15B02 for ex.).
  314:     Echo = os:cmd([$e, $c, "ho"]),
  315:     true = erlang:is_list(Echo),
  316:     %% FYI: [$e, $c, "ho"] =:= io_lib:format("ec~s", ["ho"])
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: %% Test to make sure that the correct data is
  320: %% received when doing large commands.
  321: large_output_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     %% Maximum allowed on windows is 8192, so we test well below that
  323:     AAA = lists:duplicate(7000, $a),
  324:     comp(AAA,os:cmd("echo " ++ AAA)).
  325: 
  326: %% Test that it is possible on unix to start a background task using os:cmd.
  327: background_command() ->
  328:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  329: background_command(_Config) ->
  330:     %% This testcase fails when the os:cmd takes
  331:     %% longer then the 5 second timeout
  332:     os:cmd("sleep 10&").
  333: 
  334: %% Test that message does not leak to the calling process
  335: message_leak(_Config) ->
  336:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  337: 
  338:     os:cmd("echo hello"),
  339:     [] = receive_all(),
  340: 
  341:     case os:type() of
  342:         {unix, _} ->
  343:             os:cmd("for i in $(seq 1 100); do echo hello; done&"),
  344:             [] = receive_all();
  345:         _ ->
  346:             ok % Cannot background on non-unix
  347:     end,
  348: 
  349:     process_flag(trap_exit, false).
  350: 
  351: %% Test that os:cmd closes stdin of the program that is executed
  352: close_stdin() ->
  353:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  354: close_stdin(Config) ->
  355:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  356:     Fds = filename:join(DataDir, "my_fds"),
  357: 
  358:     "0" = os:cmd(Fds).
  359: 
  360: max_size_command(_Config) ->
  361:     WSL = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
  362:               false -> "";
  363:               _ -> "wsl "
  364:           end,
  365: 
  366:     Res20 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 20 }),
  367:     20 = length(Res20),
  368: 
  369:     Res0 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 0 }),
  370:     0 = length(Res0),
  371: 
  372:     Res32768 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 32768 }),
  373:     32768 = length(Res32768),
  374: 
  375:     ResHello = string:trim(os:cmd("echo hello", #{ max_size => 20 })),
  376:     5 = length(ResHello).
  377: 
  378: %% Test that the os:perf_counter api works as expected
  379: perf_counter_api(_Config) ->
  380: 
  381:     true = is_integer(os:perf_counter()),
  382:     true = os:perf_counter() > 0,
  383: 
  384:     Conv = fun(T1, T2) ->
  385:                    erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, perf_counter, nanosecond)
  386:            end,
  387: 
  388:     do_perf_counter_test([], Conv, 120000000, 80000000),
  389:     do_perf_counter_test([1000], fun(T1, T2) -> T2 - T1 end, 120, 80).
  390: 
  391: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower) ->
  392:     %% We run the test multiple times to try to get a somewhat
  393:     %% stable value... what does this test? That the
  394:     %% calculate_perf_counter_unit in sys_time.c works somewhat ok.
  395:     do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, 10).
  396: 
  397: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, _Conv, Upper, Lower, 0) ->
  398:     ct:fail("perf_counter_test ~p ~p ~p",[CntArgs, Upper, Lower]);
  399: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters) ->
  400: 
  401:     T1 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  402:     timer:sleep(100),
  403:     T2 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  404:     TsDiff = Conv(T1, T2),
  405:     ct:log("T1: ~p~n"
  406:            "T2: ~p~n"
  407:            "TsDiff: ~p~n",
  408:            [T1,T2,TsDiff]),
  409: 
  410:     if
  411:         TsDiff < Upper, TsDiff > Lower ->
  412:             ok;
  413:         true ->
  414:             do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters-1)
  415:     end.
  416: 
  417: error_info(Config) ->
  418: 
  419: 
  420:     ExhaustFDs =
  421:         fun(M,F,A) ->
  422:                 case no_limit_for_opened_files() of
  423:                     false ->
  424:                         {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  425:                         FN = filename:join(
  426:                                proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  427:                                "error_info"),
  428:                         try
  429:                             erpc:call(
  430:                               Node,
  431:                               fun() ->
  432:                                       io:format("Starting to open files..."),
  433:                                       (fun FDs(N) ->
  434:                                                case file:open(FN, [write]) of
  435:                                                    {ok, _ } -> FDs(N+1);
  436:                                                    {error, _} ->
  437:                                                        io:format("Opened ~p files",[N])
  438:                                                end
  439:                                        end)(0),
  440:                                       apply(M,F,A)
  441:                               end)
  442:                         catch error:{exception, ErrorReason, StackTrace} ->
  443:                                 erlang:raise(error, ErrorReason, StackTrace)
  444:                         after
  445:                             peer:stop(Peer)
  446:                         end;
  447:                     true ->
  448:                         apply(M,F,A)
  449:                 end
  450:         end,
  451: 
  452:     L = [{cmd, [{no, string}]},
  453:          {cmd, [["echo 1",0,0,0,1]]},
  454:          {cmd, [{no, string}, #{}]},
  455:          {cmd, [{no, string}, no_map]},
  456:          {cmd, ["echo 1"], [{general, "too many open files \\(emfile\\)"},
  457:                             {wrapper, ExhaustFDs}] ++
  458:               [no_fail || no_limit_for_opened_files()]},
  459: 
  460:          {find_executable, 1},                  %Not a BIF.
  461:          {find_executable, 2},                  %Not a BIF.
  462: 
  463:          {getenv, [a]},
  464:          {getenv, [[<<"bin">>]]},
  465:          {getenv, [[-1]]},
  466:          {getenv, [[999999999999999]]},
  467:          {getenv, [["abc"|improper_tail]]},
  468:          {getenv, ["abc="]},
  469:          {getenv, ["abc\0xyz"]},
  470: 
  471:          {getenv,[a, default]},
  472: 
  473:          {perf_counter,[bad_time_unit]},
  474: 
  475:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, <<"bad_value">>],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  476:          {putenv, ["key", <<"bad_value">>]},
  477:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, "value"]},
  478:          {putenv, ["abc=", "xyz"]},
  479: 
  480:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  481:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  482:          {set_signal, [bad_signal, bad_handling]},
  483:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, bad_handling],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  484: 
  485:          {system_time, [bad_time_unit]},
  486:          {unsetenv, [{bad,key}]}
  487:         ],
  488:     error_info_lib:test_error_info(os, L).
  489: 
  490: %% Check that is *not* possible to change shell after startup
  491: os_cmd_shell(_Config) ->
  492: 
  493:     application:set_env(kernel, os_cmd_shell, "broken shell"),
  494: 
  495:     %% os:cmd should continue to work as normal
  496:     comp("hello", os:cmd("echo hello")).
  497: 
  498: %% When started with os_cmd_shell set, we make sure that it is used.
  499: os_cmd_shell_peer(Config) ->
  500:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  501:     SysShell = "\"" ++ filename:join(DataDir, "sys_shell") ++ "\"",
  502:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-kernel","os_cmd_shell", SysShell]),
  503:     try erpc:call(Node, os, cmd, ["ls"], rtnode:timeout(normal)) of
  504:         "sys_shell" -> ok;
  505:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  506:     catch
  507:         C:R:Stk ->
  508:             io:format("~p\n~p\n~p\n", [C,R,Stk]),
  509:             ct:fail(failed)
  510:     after
  511:         peer:stop(Peer)
  512:     end.
  513: 
  514: no_limit_for_opened_files() ->
  515:     case os:type() of
  516:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  517:             %% At least some FreeBSD systems support about one million open
  518:             %% files, which means that we run out of Erlang processes before we
  519:             %% reach the open file limit.
  520:             true;
  521:         {unix, _} ->
  522:             false;
  523:         _ ->
  524:             true
  525:     end.
  526: 
  527: %% Util functions
  528: 
  529: comp(Expected, Got) ->
  530:     case strip_nl(Got) of
  531: 	Expected ->
  532: 	    ok;
  533: 	Other ->
  534: 	    ok = io:format("Expected: ~ts\n", [Expected]),
  535: 	    ok = io:format("Got:      ~ts\n", [Other]),
  536: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  537:     end.
  538: 
  539: %% strips \n and \r\n from end of string
  540: 
  541: strip_nl([$\r, $\n]) -> [];
  542: strip_nl([$\n])      -> [];
  543: strip_nl([H|T])      -> [H|strip_nl(T)];
  544: strip_nl([])         -> [].
  545: 
  546: receive_all() ->
  547:     receive
  548: 	X -> [X|receive_all()]
  549:     after 0 -> []
  550:     end.
